DOC.brief_summary: The Transversus Abdominal Plane (TAP) block has been used with good success to decrease postoperative pain following laparatomy. If the TAP block provides any improvement in the quality of recovery following laparoscopic hysterectomy, it could decrease the need for postoperative narcotics and allow for more outpatient hysterectomy procedures.
DOC.brief_title: Transversus Abdominal Plane Block at Total Laparoscopic Hysterectomy: Effect on Quality of Recovery
DOC.criteria: Any patient undergoing laparoscopic hysterectomy Age ranges 1880 Reading literacy English speaking Able to give informed consent History of relevant drug allergy Chronic opioid users who may have tolerance to pain medications Inability to understand written consent forms or give consent Age less than 18 or over 80 Any conversion to open surgery
